msItem.author: Schönbeck, Brun von
msItem.title: Ave Maria
msItem.incipit: God de ware trinitat de alle dink gheschapen hat
msItem.explicit: de van der sunnen weren bedacht.

msItem.author: Schönbeck, Brun von
msItem.title: Van der almissen
msItem.explicit: An enen salmen dar he sprikt ...

handDesc.p: Cursive script in one hand; Latin quotations in a somewhat larger Gothic book-hand.

decoNote.p: Red lombards; at f. 2v (=page 4) in part 1: an initial (W) with the left serif extended and decorated with a plume in brown ink; first letter of each verse is marked in red.

binding.p: There is no binding. The fragments are kept separately in an archival folder.

foliation.p: Part 1 is both paginated (Arabic numbers) and foliated (Roman numbers) by Norlind with a pencil; the leaves of part 1 are ff. 1-14 or pp. 1-28; the leaves of part 2 are only foliated: ff. x1-x4.

additions.p: Sometimes notes in margin by a younger hand.

acquisition.p: The loose leaves, most of them cut and in a very poor condition, were found in 1925 by Wilhelm Norlind (1895-1982), librarian at Lund University Library, as binding material in L. Cellot, Panegyrici et orationes, Paris, 1631.

source.p: Catalogued by Margarete Andersson-Schmitt, the manuscript description encoded in April, 2002 by Eva Nilsson Nylander.

surrogates.p: There are 26 black and white photographs of the fragment in a folder marked "Fotokopia. Medelt.-hdskr. 32b, Bruno von Schonebeck".

bibl.author: Norlind, W.
bibl.title: Neuaufgefundene Bruchstücke des "Ave Marie" Bruns von Schönebeck
Jahrbuch des Vereins für niederdeutsche Sprachforschung
bibl.biblScope: pp. 59-87, from p. 64 an edition of the fragments.

bibl.author: Norlind, W.
bibl.title: Nyfunna fragment i Lunds universitetsbibliotek
Nordisk tidskrift för bok- och biblioteksväsen

bibl.author: Wolff, L.
bibl.title: Brun von Schönebeck
Die deutsche Literatur des Mittelalters. Verfasserlexikon,
bibl.biblScope: coll. 1056-1061. Medeltidshandskrift 32b is mentioned in col. 1057.
